answers.answer: I don't think it sounds like seizures, but I am not a doctor and cannot diagnose symptoms.I think you should mention this to your doctor and see what she has to say.I wonder if she did this before the diabetes was diagnosed and you just didn't notice.I have a five year old son(not diabetic) who takes a while to fall into a deep sound sleep.  He turns and jerks around quite a bit before he falls asleep.  My daughter on the other hand does not move much at all when she falls asleep and it seems like she sleeps more peacefully.   So, I wonder if it is just her nature or pattern for falling asleep.

question: I have a 5 yr old girl with type 1 diabetes.  When put to bed in the evening for about the first 80 minutes whilst sleeping she seems to have jerking motions ranging from her legs/arms/hands/body/feet that jerk periodically, they are not violent motions just very slight movements.  They do settle after a while but wonder if this is a related condition of diabetes.
title: Jerking movements whilst sleeping
